Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the impact of the $90 million investment in traffic fixes, as not all of the projects funded by the bonds are directly related to road improvements.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the $90 million investment in traffic fixes will effectively address and alleviate traffic issues in Austin, without providing enough evidence or support for this assumption.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that the $90 million investment in traffic fixes will be successful in achieving its intended goals.
Exist alternative explanation: There could be alternative explanations for the improvements in traffic conditions in Austin, such as other factors or initiatives that were not mentioned in the claim.
